medium_description_en: Calculates sodium quantity missing in hyponatremia.

seo.meta_description_en: The Sodium Deficit in Hyponatremia Calculates sodium quantity missing in hyponatremia.
seo.keywords_en: Sodium Deficit in Hyponatremia, na deficit, na calc, na deficit calc, na deficit score, hyponatremia, hyponatremia calc, hyponatremia deficit, fluids hyponatremia

how_to_use.why_use_en: Estimates the total amount of sodium that needs to be replaced in hyponatremia patients.

next_steps.advice_en: Correct hyponatremia carefully. Do not forget to correct the hyponatremia level in hyperglycemic patients with the Sodium Correction for Hyperglycemia calculator. Use with the Sodium Correction Rate in Hyponatremia calculator which estimates the rate to correct, as well as tonicity of the solution used. Typically hypertonic solutions are reserved for patients that are overly symptomatic, such as seizures and severe neurologic deficits.

about.formula_en:
Sodium deficit = total body water × (desired Na - pt's Na)

For adults, total body water (TBW) is calculated using the Watson equation:

  • Men: TBW, liters = 2.447 – 0.09516 × age, years + 0.1074 × height, cm + 0.3362 × weight, kg
  • Women: TBW, liters = -2.097 + 0.1069 × height, cm + 0.2466 × weight, kg

For children, TBW = 0.6 × weight, kg
about.more_info_en:
Remember not to correct too rapidly to avoid central pontine myelinolysis!

You can use the hyponatremia correction rate calculator to pick an appropriate fluid and volume as well.

creator_info.about_en: Nicolaos E. Madias, MD, is the chair of the department of medicine at the St. Elizabeth's Medical Center in Boston, Massachusetts. He is also a professor of medicine, specializing in Nephrology, at the Tufts University School of Medicine. Dr. Madias has co-authored over 100 articles published in peer reviewed journals.
